intro: Feroniella oblata, commonly known as the white star apple, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in warm, humid climates. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round berry that turns from green to yellow when ripe. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some use in traditional medicine.
